questions.text: Imagine an ideal organization utilizing digital technologies and capabilities to improve processes, engage talent across the organization, and drive new and value-generating business models. How close is your organization to that ideal?
My organization has moved significantly closer to that ideal over the past three years.
Digital innovation is a strength of my organization.
My organization's leaders think that digital innovation is or should be a core competency of our organization.
My organization provides enough resources (time, money, people) to support innovation.
My organization cultivates or supports an entrepreneurial mindset among its employees.
What portion of your work involves the opportunity to experiment and innovate?
My organization cultivates partnerships with other organizations to facilitate digital innovation.
It is important that my organization is located geographically close to our external partners for digital innovation.
My organization's external partnerships are vital to its digital innovation efforts.
My organization partners with the following types of organizations to support digital innovation.
My organization receives the following benefits from our external partnerships with respect to digital innovation.
options: Access to new ideas to grow or improve our business
Ability to develop new knowledge and skills
Additional team members to help us scale our efforts

questions.text: My organization engages in external partnerships to access new sources of data.
What is the biggest challenge associated with effectively leveraging partnerships and networks to increase digital innovations?
options: Acceptance by all levels of the company
Access to resources like skills and technologies for successful change

questions.text: My organization is currently using cross-functional teams or work groups to get work done.
Cross-functional teams work effectively in our organization to support digital business.
Cross-functional team leaders in my organization have considerable autonomy regarding how to accomplish team goals.
My organization effectively evaluates the performance of cross-functional teams as a unit.
Our organization's senior leadership effectively creates an environment in which our cross-functional teams can succeed.
Cross-functional teams in my organization share lessons learned from their successes and failures with others in the organization.
Cultural differences across functions enable/hinder the effectiveness of our cross-functional teams.
What is the biggest barrier to effectiveness in cross-functional teams?
options: Lack of leadership commitment, incentive, involvement, and vision

questions.text: Digital technologies or innovation have increased our organization's concerns around privacy.
How is working in a cross-functional team different than working in a traditional team?
options: Organization is less bureaucratic and siloed

questions.text: Our organization's leaders spend enough time thinking about and communicating the impact our organization's digital initiatives have on society.
Other than privacy, what is your biggest social/ethical concern brought about by digital innovation?
options: Strategic organizational issues (marketplace uncertainty, job replacement)
Negative impact to culture (increased bias, loss of transparency)

questions.text: My organization acts according to the values and ethics communicated by our leaders.
Our organization has explicit policies in place to support our ethical standards with respect to our organization's digital initiatives.
The laws or regulatory frameworks governing our industry adequately address how business is conducted in a digital world.
Everyone in our organization at all levels is held to the same ethical standard.
Society will be better off in 10 to 20 years than it is today as a result of digital technology.
I spend time thinking about what my career will look like in 10 years and what I need to do to prepare.
My career in the next 10 years will be better off as a result of digital trends.
In 10 to 20 years, as a result of digital trends, my organization will:
options: Not exist (either will be out of business or bought by another company)
Exist but be in a much weaker position
Exist but be in a weaker position
Exist and be no better or worse off
Exist but be in a stronger position
Exist but be in a much stronger position

questions.text: Why do you think your organization will be in that position in 10 to 20 years?
I will be in a fundamentally different career in 10 years than I am today as a result of digital trends.
